questions.question: What is the primary goal of the problem/solution fit interview sprint?
options: Validate that target customers experience a painful problem your concept can solve
questions.explanation: Interviews confirm the problem is urgent and that the proposed solution resonates before investing heavily.

questions.question: In the lean business model canvas, which block covers how you will reach customers?
questions.explanation: Channels describe the paths you use to acquire, deliver to, and support customers.

questions.question: Which financial metric reveals how quickly you consume available cash each month?
questions.explanation: Burn rate tracks monthly cash outflow and informs how much runway you have left.

questions.question: Bootstrapping relies on customer revenue and personal savings instead of outside equity.
questions.explanation: Bootstrapped founders self-fund operations, retaining full ownership and control.

questions.question: Which lightweight experiment best validates pricing assumptions before launch?
options: Running a pre-sale landing page with checkout
questions.explanation: Collecting deposits or signups at a proposed price confirms willingness to pay.

questions.question: Which unit economics metric compares customer lifetime value to the cost of acquiring that customer?
questions.explanation: CAC payback shows how long it takes gross profit to recover acquisition spending.

questions.question: A minimum viable marketing plan (MVMP) focuses spend on the two or three channels with the strongest signal.
questions.explanation: The MVMP doubles down on the highest-performing channels instead of spreading efforts thin.

questions.question: Which legal structure offers pass-through taxation and basic liability protection for multiple founders?
questions.explanation: An LLC shields personal assets while keeping tax reporting simple for small teams.

questions.question: When preparing an investor update, which trio provides the clearest snapshot of momentum?
options: Team birthdays, software tools, and snacks
Monthly recurring revenue, pipeline, and key experiments
Office layout, paid ads, and invoices
Vacation schedule, PR mentions, and swag
questions.explanation: Investors want to see revenue traction, upcoming opportunities, and what you are testing next.

questions.question: Which habit from the entrepreneurship module keeps execution aligned with quarterly goals?
options: Reviewing KPIs in a weekly operating cadence
Cycling through new ideas every day
Delegating all planning to an outside consultant
questions.explanation: A weekly rhythm meeting reviews metrics, commitments, and blockers so the team stays accountable.
